comment: Do NOT take this course. The most unclear directions week after week. She assumes everyone uses ChatGPT and will accuse you of cheating, so be prepared to back up all of your work. You'll never know your actual grade for anything. Psychology is an interesting subject and this was just disappointing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: RUN I REPEAT RUN!!! I've never ever rated a professor but she is absolutely horrible. She acts like this is the only class I have and don't get me started on the stupid discussion posts that she accuses everyone of using ChatGPT on, there are lots of them, and the formatting of the class in d2l is confusing!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Her instructions are very unclear and at times contradictory to what she expects of you. The workload for this course is insane, more than my other three courses combined. If you're not majoring in psyc, DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE. If you work full-time or are in the military, DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE. You won't have enough time to do the work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Very unclear with what she wants out of assignments, she would constantly have to change the assignment steps because no one understood. Incompetent, rude, and confusing. I don't recommend this class to ANYONE unless you are looking to suffer for a semester. Her rating speaks for itself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I did not enjoy Dr. Wood once this semester. She accused me of using a.i and threatened to take it to the dean, she was rude countless times, instructions were very unclear, and SO much homework. The only way I got through was a class GroupMe, it seemed like everyone in there felt the same way as me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Wood takes a very long time to grade the many assignments given, and is often unclear in exactly what she wants in your discussion posts leaving you wondering if you will even get a good grade. I didn't even know I had a B until midterms.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She is an awesome teacher. Works with you all semester and gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you are reading this drop the class right now..... I took this class a while back, and have never rated any of my professors, however for an INTRODUCTORY course all I'm going to say is read the first sentence again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: AWFUL BRO!!! I'm a first year who was taking intro to general psych for credits and she was terrible. She doesn't communicate well, and tried out a new grading system which was terrible, and wouldn't make up for her lack of teaching and instructions properly. My classmates had a group like where we had to work together just to pass. DON'T TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This class was taxing. The system that worked for me was reading the chapter as early as I possibly could in order to have time to complete all the other stuff she assigned. Grading is really strange and she is not very good with replying to Teams comments on time or grading on time. this class would be better taken in person than online.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Grading system is done through a work based climb the ladder mindset where you start with a F and have to complete assignments to get a higher grade throughout the course. Terribly organized with assignments all over the place, emails are also extremely non helpful and don't answer the questions you ask her, she just says to refer back to the FAQ.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had to drop this class for my own sanity. This professor is horrible and her Specs system of grading is confusing and is worse than the normal way of grading. I did everything required to get at least a C but she said I was failing. Theres so much reading, and unnecessary virtual Labs that don't teach us a thing. For your own sake DON'T TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I ultimately decided to drop the class. It was horribly unorganized. There was no clear way to see which assignments we're due and when. She graded using the Spec system meaning you start with an F and as you complete assignments your grade goes up front there. She also acted like if you took that class you were a psyc major.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I've ever had. Takes everything way too serious. Doesn't seem to care that this is an introductory level psych class that most people are taking as a core class instead of for their major. She grades weird too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The worst teacher I have ever had. have to complete a criteria per grade starting at D (cannot get an A without getting a B/C/D first). Currently a Junior majoring in I.T, class is hard. Emailing her 1-3 times per week minimum. does not have her stuff together, technical problem on her end? your problem. LOTS of readying. READING REQUIRED
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: if you have a busy life or are just trying to get through college- do not take this professor. does not round up grades, says she will report you for violating student codes for everything and asks for too much. for a psychology class this was really disappointing, take another professor. grading is also tough and rigid, there are no exceptions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: She is so terrible. So much work for the entire semester graded with a "Not Yet" which means no credit, a completion grade, or an exceeds expectations. I didn't know my grade for the entire semester. She uses AI checkers, and gives you grades based off that. I wrote my final paper BY MYSELF, and got an F because of Turnitin AI checker. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Awful. She expects corrections of the final project after the last day of class. Of course this is because she takes forever to put grades on the gradebook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT take this professor! I have no idea why an INTRO psychology class was as difficult as It was. She has a very weird grading schedule that would only work if she actually graded on time. She was always behind on grading and super strict (which makes no sense because she had a teacher's aid) Save yourself the headache.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment:
Other ratings are pretty accurate. I believe she truly loves what she teaches, but the course can be unnecessarily difficult, especially as a freshman.

Grading is very different from other classes you may be confused about your grade until finals week so if this a problem for you do NOT take!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I'm a pretty good student, I have NEVER received lower than a B in any class. Maybe ONE C in high school when I was out due to covid, yet I still managed to get a D in this class. All the work u do throughout the semester does not matter unless ur final projects are PERFECT. She isn't understanding at all! Save urself and don't take her class!

comment: She turns in all assignments to Turnitin. She claimed I plagiarized and I didn't and now I have a case with the school department.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: DO'NT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!! Along with weekly assignments, u have to do a project for each lettergrade u want to receive & they dont guarantee u that grade. She is a super hard grader. rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class. You will do so much work for basically nothing unless you do 3 modules that determine if you get a C, B, or A. comment: I wish I could write a long review explaining why she is not a good professor. Her grading method makes no sense since she takes a very long time to update grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: I had high expectations for her because she 'actually teaches'. This course does not teach you about psychology, she only cares about your citations. If you complete the weekly work you will get a D, if you do 3 final assignments your grade will escalate as you turn in the assignments correctly. She is tough when it comes to citations and AI

I had expectations of this class being tough because it is an online class.Dr.Wood is a cool teacher, but she is too tough on grading and assignments.She is not bad, and assignments are easy. We did so much but it didn't matter because an A,B, and C module and whether or not they are completed PERFECTLY will determine your grade in this class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Unnecessarily difficult. Instructions often unclear on assignments but she is very strict on grading. Does not give good feedback. Uses unclear methods of communication and confusing sites to get work done. Overall not a good experience

comment: professor wood had very high expectations, but were very hard to obtain. she made it very hard to complete a class
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Course layout is difficult, doesn't use traditional grading. Is out of office often, responds to emails after a couple days often. No tests or quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: This was an online class and It was so difficult for no reasons and I have taken online classes.

This course is just a cat and mouse game of resubmitting assignments until Dr. Wood feels they are to her personal standard, not even the rubric standards.

comment: This class is hard for no reason. Dr. Wood makes everything confusing, and there are so many assignments. I couldn't take it, so  I withdrew from the class. Please stay away from her if you want a good GPA. Even if you're smart she'll give you a zero for something so dumb. DO NOT TAKE HER.

comment:

comment: Wish I can put a 0. I am not one to give out bad ratings here in fact I am a junior and this is only my second. Stay as far away from this professor as you can! comment: Do not take this class if you have other classes with a big course load or if you have a job outside of school. It requires a lot of your time and you need to be ready to dedicate most of your week to finishing the assignments by the due date, which for some stuff is as early as Tuesday.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is not the best. There are three major assignments that determine your grade in the class but there's weekly work too that must be done. comment: At first I didnt think I would be able to pass the class, then I learn more about her grading and pass the class eventually. Very hard class but taught me a lot. Would recommend if you want a challenge

comment: The instructor disregarded student complaints about weekly assignment due dates and did not grade assignments in time for students to know if an assignment was incomplete or not accepted. rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: took this my freshman year of college, and she has made my college experience terrible so far. If you do the heavy workload that is assigned, you will ONLY earn a D in this class. comment: I have never recipes anything lower than a B in a class. Yet somehow I managed to get a plagiarism charge as well as redoing an assignment over 5 times. Every Assignment is Pass/Fail. This professor is the absolute worst. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I have never seen a teacher so behind on grading before. She is 8 weeks behind! But the worst part is that she wrote me up for plagiarism because, and I quote,"use too many quotes." This professor is by far the least clear I have ever had. She has gone WEEKS without grading, then out of no where, issues incompletes, which are zeros all at once with ZERO feedback. comment: DO NOT TAKE. If you have any interest in getting an A, be prepared to do a lot of writing comparable to an upperclassman Psych Major. comment: I was a DE student taking this class for college credit. DE students are suppose to get extra help and in some cases different work. My other classes were manageable except this one . comment: I have never failed a class in my entire life. I will either be failing or withdrawing from this class, no in-between. She treats this class like a psych major trying to earn their masters. comment: Gave me a 54 on an assignment where I addressed everything in the prompt and elaborated healthily. comment: do not take this professor!

comment: sorry, but she is the worst professor i have ever taken... any time i had questions, she constantly talked to me like i was stupid. she has the worst grading system, if you fail one assignment, you cant make higher than a D in the course.... which is terrible. avoid at all cost
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: took this class recently. Was accused of cheating. No email from Virginia regarding cheating but rather an email from some guy at ksu requesting a zoom call. comment: I am currently taking this class and have not passed anything since the start of the semester. comment: Stay clear of this woman like she is the plague. The grading system is a no credit/pass grade. Not to mention that you need to pass ALL of the modules to obtain a C in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: STAY AWAY. 0/10 DONT RECOMMEND! has a weird pass/no credit grading, 15 modules and you must pass everything in the module in order to get a C or higher in the class, a lot of reading, TOUGH grader, a lot of work for no reason, not clear with instructions.. in conclusion, i dropped the class..
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible experience. Very unclear with what needed to be done and gave horrible directions. She does not even seem to care about what grade you get. Has a weird pass/fail system and will fail you if your work is doesn't completely follow her vague instructions. Assigns questions due on Mondays that are connected to chapters that have like 30-ish pages. With the way she grades, it's possible for you to complete nearly every assignment perfectly and still only make a C because of a single grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESSOR!! a weird pass/fail grading system, read more than you would read in an english class, very tough grader, so much work to do and the instructions arent clear at all, reading the entire psyc textbook, 0/10 would not recommend at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Her grading system is pass or no credit and its complicated for no reason when she could do percentages like everyone else. Her test arent related to the material we learn. Youll read more in her class than youd read in English class. Her instructions for work is never clear. This class was so frustrating that I dropped it within the first week
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: You read a total of 15 chapters that you must have memorized in order to pass the final and midterm. Write a whole bunch of papers that she nitpicks about (not stated on her rubrics). Do not meet at all and does not teach. Weeks (5-7) go by without any grades put in and she makes excuses. Condescending in feedback, rants about her life. Do NOT take

Weird pass/fail grading system, did all of my work but because 2 of my assignments weren't specific enough for her so I got a C. Grading is super tough for having to learn everything by reading a book. Also just way to many assignments in general.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: First of all, I didnt pick this professor. Somehow Kennesaw switched my professor. Grading is based on Pass, Attempt or Fail. She does a lot for it to be a 1101 class. Stay far away from her and she doesnt put in grades and nit picks on everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: The grading criteria was very confusing and she takes forever to grade assignments. Ive never received a C until I took this class and I do not feel like my work is represented by a C. She is a weird pass/ fail grading system that makes the class pretty much impossible.
rating_tags: So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Wood is such a caring professor, and will assist you. Getting an A wasnt the easiest though, you need to put in the work. Assignments were easy for me because I followed the samples and rubrics. Show up to class, do the readings, and follow the guidelines for assignments and youll be good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: read the textbook! she expects everyone to know the material and volunteer in class to give answers. there is a year long research project that counts for the majority of your grade along with the final (the only test).if you do the work and study, youll get an a.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was only writing papers, and it was a Pass/Fail course. I would take her again, and she cares so much about her students. She's extremely understanding to mental health, and she thinks of her students first always. Very sweet & loving.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Professor Wood is unique, and she works hard to make her lectures interesting and useful to your life. Her grading is very fair. Read the chapters, take a short quiz, and put decent effort into two written assignments, and you should have an A. She also expects you to participate in class. I would take one of her classes again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Wood was a great teacher and I learned a lot in her class. Her lectures are always interesting and match up to her tests and quizzes, which test whether you get the whole idea of whatever the chapter is about, not details like names and dates. She also lets you choose your own essay topics . Happy to meet with you outside class, gives extra credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: Virginia Wood wants everyone in her class to know her political opinions, and spends most of her lecture time explaining why these opinions are the only correct opinions, attempting to justify her "logic" with tidbits of psychology fun facts. Easy class, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: The lectures literally don't help at all. This class was taken way too seriously for an introductory course. During lectures she babbles on about her life. The test and midterm are very difficult and include short answers. The final is cumulative based on 15 chapters of information and she not only wants the information to be memorized but applied.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Wood is very nice and will make sure you get what you need out of the course. There will be quizes over every two chapters or so but if you do the practice test in the book you'll be fine, she also goes by a point system so it's pretty hard to mess up.

Wood is a dyed in the wool feminist. She is anti-male and in her private practice, caters to mostly women. Her dedication to supporting homosexuality makes her rabidly anti-religion.  Ethics is important, but her ethics are relative to her pet causes. Avoid unless you like liberal indoctrination.

Dr. Wood's is nice and helpful but unorganized.  I never feel like I've learned something when I leave.  It's important that you read the book b/c she likes for people to get into a discussion in class. Talks too much about her clients and makes inapproprate jobs in class.  I personally am not taking her again.

I would not take Professor Wood again. She was not organized, and was very scatter-brained. She also made inappropriate jokes about her clients often, it made me uncomfortable. She was unclear about what she expected on papers. I made an A, but I would not recommend her due to her teaching style.

She was down to earth,the material was alittle redundant;however she was more concern with us learning &knowing the material.Attendance is a must! Awesome teache,becuz she covered must of the material in class..which right now i still rememeber.
No Comments
Awesome. Really knows her stuff, makes it interesting.
